Fields.DialogueText: Captain, Morganas are surrounding us on all sides.
I got that from the alarm. Where's McDougal? She's usually on top of combat situations.
She's the one who told us. You saw how quickly they snuck up - if it wasn't for her we would've been caught completely unawares.
There's no time to waste. Get everyone in position and let's make sure we see tomorrow.
@BATTLE
That was... not nearly as fun as it should've been.
What's going on? How are the Morganas catching us with our pants down?
Did you say something? My ears are still ringing.

Fields.MenuText: Who do I have to reprimand to make sure this never happens again?
Are the Morganas getting stronger? Or sneakier, at least?
Don't make me repeat myself, McDougal. This is serious.

Fields.DialogueText: It wasn't anyone's fault, all right? I should've seen them coming from a mile away. I don't know how I didn't.
I wouldn't say stronger. We're still standing. Sneakier, however... maybe they've got something up their sleeves.
Hey, calm down. I don't know how they're doing it, but I'm going to be doing my best to make sure it doesn't happen again.
Maybe we should make port for now. Make sure we're at least ready for the next time.
If there's a next time. This is only the second time lately, right?
Better safe than dead.
Hey, Captain. What's up?
Could you keep an eye on what we take on board again? You did a fine job last time.
Maybe if you ask nicely.

Fields.MenuText: Please, will you do me this favor?
Never mind, not worth it. I'll do it.
On second thought, you probably shouldn't. You'll stop as soon as you see the pie.

Fields.DialogueText: Pfbt. Captain, there's no need to beg.
Oh, come on! Fine, fine, fine. You got me.
Pie, you say? You can count me in.
I've got nothing better to do, anyway.
Thank you, McDougal. It's appreciated.
If you really want to thank me, maybe think about getting me a shiny new gun to bloody up.
Captain, there are reports of a group of Morganas nearby.
How close? Do we have time to resupply?
We should. They don't seem to be heading our way. I just figured McDougal might want to take care of them.
You're probably right. Looks like we have our next destination.
@BATTLE
McDougal, what are you doing?
I'm watching out for Morganas. Making sure we aren't surprised again. I thought that's what you wanted.
I thought you sensed them. I didn't think sight was actually a factor.
You have a problem with my process?

Fields.MenuText: You know, if you lean too far, you'll fall over the edge of the bow.
Not if it gets results. Have you gotten any results?
No, but I've got a problem with that look in your eye.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't worry, Cap, I can swim. And levitate, and walk through walls, and shoot death rays out of my eyes when I'm hungry. A little water won't hurt me.
Have we been attacked?
Oh, my apologies. I'll be sure to gouge my eyes out at your leisure.
I get the picture.
I really want to see those death rays sometime, by the way.
Wait until lunchtime and see what kind of lines we've got in the mess.
No.
There's your answer.
I'll get the knife.
I see two can play at this sarcasm game.
Stop the presses! A small group is coming up from behind us.
I guess your process works after all.
Don't forget it.
@BATTLE
Hey, McDougal. How are you...?
Okay, you want something.
Captain, I have a small request. Puny even. You'll hardly notice it.

Fields.MenuText: Well, spit it out already.
If it's that small, it shouldn't be an issue.
Sounds too good to be true, coming from you.

Fields.DialogueText: Before I do, I need you to keep an open mind, okay?
Well, it might be just a tad larger than advertised, but still pretty tiny.
Should I even bother sugar coating it for you?
Probably not.
Hmmmm....
What is it, McDougal?
There's a really big Morgana to the east. Can I go kill her and her friends?
I suppose I should be glad you're asking me rather than just taking us straight to it.
Well, I know how much trust means to you. You can trust me to tell you when I'm sensing Morganas, and I hope you can trust me to blow ‘em up.
Please, stop playing with Mr. Contingency-Plan.
Oh, sorry, habit.
So are we good to change course?
I know better than to try and say no.
You're so smart, Captain. It's amazing.
You can stop greasing the wheels. You already got what you wanted.
Good point!
@BATTLE
Hey, McDougal.
Do you have a minute?
Ugh. Sure, but...
I know what you're gonna say, Cap, so let me just start with "I'm sorry."

Fields.MenuText: So am I. We blundered into that battle before we were ready. We're lucky you're still seaworthy.
For what? That last engagement? Come on, that battle had all the explosions you could've wanted.
No, you're not. This ship could sink to the bottom of the ocean, and you'd be fine as long as you got to use Mr. Contingency-Plan in the end.

Fields.DialogueText: You're right. I underestimated our opponent. It won't happen again.
Hey, the only kind of explosions I like are on the enemy ship. They're not nearly as fun when they're on your own deck.
That's crap, and you should know better. No one wants to use their contingency plan. It's only there in case there aren't any better options.
At the very least, we can say we won. We might have gotten rattled, but the other guys are doing a lot worse.
The Morganas are getting harder to handle. They're sneaking up on us, they're overpowering us...
Sounds like we need a new weapon under our belt.
A new weapon... or maybe new allies...
Allies? Captain, you don't need anyone else. You've got me!
Yeah. And you'll sink yourself trying to win this war on your own if I let you.
Can we just take a second and think about this?
*ALARM*
Doesn't sound like it. Let's hope we can fend these Morganas off without taking any more damage to our hull.
@BATTLE
All right, that ought to do it.
Make sure this letter goes through the proper channels. I don't want it read before it reaches its destination.
Yes, Captain. Right away.

Fields.MenuText: The faster that message gets out, the better.
Thank goodness that's taken care of.

Fields.DialogueText: So, she was obviously hiding something. Anything I should know about?
Whoa, where's the fire? That officer nearly ran me over!
What was that? You having secret meetings without me now?
It's nothing for now. I'll loop you in if anything develops.
You'd better. I'll remember if you don't.
That's my fault. I told him to run. Sorry.
Then I should be yelling at you. The nerve of some folks, trying to get me run over.
Well, if I invited everyone it wouldn't be much of a secret, now, would it?
I don't really like secrets. So if you wanna stay on my good side, you should start looping me in.
Oh, right, I wanted to let you know the hull's repair is shaping up. We should be good as new soon.
That was fast.
Let's just say I know how to motivate people to get the lead outta their asses.
Yeah, I feel comfortable leaving it at that. Just let me know when we're patched up.
You got it, Cap.
*ALARM*
Damn it!
Are we in fighting shape?
Better'n we were, and that'll have to be as good as new!
@BATTLE
Captain?
Zzzzzzzz....
Poke!
Captain, you ready to celebrate?

Fields.MenuText: I'm awake, I'm awake!
Oh, McDougal, thank God you woke me up. I was just having the worst nightmare.
Ugggh, shhh. I'm already celebrating in my dream.

Fields.DialogueText: Seriously, Captain, sleeping on the job?
Oh, yeah? What was it about? Tiger men from Mars, or everyone's a clown?
I've got a feeling I don't want to know how dream-you celebrates.
I had some free time, and I took advantage of it. I hardly get to take naps anymore.
Actually it was the one where you and Mr. Contingency-Plan switch places. He keeps threatening to use you if he doesn't get his way.
Heh. Yeah, that sounds like him. What a character.
I've got a feeling I don't want to tell you. Now if you'd please, I'd like to finish my dream.
Well, back here in the real world - you know, the world afflicted with Morganas - it's time to test out our repairs.
The hull is finished?
Ding-ding-ding, give our contestant a prize!
And I'm guessing you want us to find a Morgana for this test?
Okay, now you're just cheating.
How are we on supplies?
Adequately stocked and ready to rumble.
Then I have no reason to say no.
Captain's on board, people! Let's get this ship moving... and not a moment too soon, if my senses are right!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Hey, Captain - you almost missed the fun!
Though if you ever want me to take over again....
Much appreciated - but not today.
Fair enough.
@BATTLE
Oh, yes! We're unbeatable. There's not a Morgana around that can take on the great McDougal!
McDougal, get down from there.
Yeah, you heard me, Morganas! All of you! I could defeat you all with one hand tied behind my back!
You're causing a scene. We've already won.
Oh, come on, Captain, you know you want to gloat a little too. I mean, we just took down some of the baddest of the bad. They didn't know who they were messing with!

Fields.MenuText: All right, fine, move over.
Gloating has never done anyone any good.
Not even a little. Now get down.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! I knew I'd bring you around!
I beg to differ. It's doing me a world of good right now.
You're such a party killer, you know that?
You have to admit, though, it felt great showing them a thing or two.
Yeah, especially after taking that huge hit. Not only to the ship, but to our egos.
And to think we were worried they were getting stronger.
I still am. You're acting like that was easy. We broke more than a sweat.
Was the poor widdle captain scared?
No! You know what I mean.
I'm just not worried. I mean, look at me. Look at how awesome I am.
All that fighting made me hungry. I'm gonna go get a slice of pie. I'd invite you along, but then there'd be less pie for me.
At least she's confident.
Hey, Cappy, grabbing lunch?
Yeah, and it looks like the rest of the ship is too. I can't find a seat anywhere.
Oh, I gotcha. Gimme a second.
Hey, you two. Get on up and outta here.
Excuse me?
Oh, I'm sorry, did I stutter? LEAVE.
You can't just make us leave. Where do you want us to eat? The hallway?
I don't care where you go. You're just not staying here.
Make us.
I'm sorry, did you say something? I was too busy reloading my many, many guns to hear you. Could you repeat that?
Uh, the seats are yours.
That's what I thought you said.
Captain, over here. Two seats just opened up.

Fields.MenuText: Ah, yes, the classic McDougal Diplomacy.
I could've just eaten on the deck. You didn't need to threaten anyone.
I suppose I should be happy you didn't actually shoot them.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't be sarcastic. I can be diplomatic when I want to be.
What are you talking about? Threatening, pshaw. If you want to see a threat, I can show you a threat.
Please, I wouldn't waste ammo on friendly fire. Each of my shells has a Morgana's name on it.
*ALARM*
Looks like you better eat fast. Fun's knocking on our door.
@BATTLE
McDougal?
What's up? You look like you want to set something on fire.
More than usual, I mean.
We're making port again? Come on, I'm getting antsy.

Fields.MenuText: It's just a short stop. We'll be back on the seas blasting Morganas before you know it.
Calm down. Better safe than sorry.
We'll stop when I decide it's necessary. Do you have a problem with that?

Fields.DialogueText: We better be. I guess while we're here I might as well take a break.
Don't tell me what to do. I'll calm down when all the Morganas are dead in the water.
Fine, be that way.
I'll be in my quarters if you need me.
Captain, you've received word.
Already? A letter or a transmission?
Letter. Here it is.
That's a good sign. It's too much effort for a refusal. But so soon...
Maybe they're having as much trouble as we are.
Let's hope so. It'll make negotiations less one-sided.
*ALARM*
Looks like I'll have to read this later. Go get McDougal from her quarters.
I'm pretty sure she's already on deck after hearing the alarm.
You're probably right.
@BATTLE
McDougal, can I come in? I need to talk to you.
Captain, come in. I'll get us something to drink.
I'm glad to see you're in a good mood.
I'm always in a good mood.
We both know that's not true.
Did you say something... Captain?

Fields.MenuText: Nothing important.
You know you can be cranky, McDougal. Don't act like this is news.
Nice try, but I've gotten used to that glare of yours.

Fields.DialogueText: Glad to hear it.
That's not a nice thing to tell your host.
You shouldn't think that I'm out of tricks up my sleeve.
*CRASH*
Watch where you're throwing things. You almost hit my face.
I'll aim better next time.
*BANG*
... Did you just throw that cup in the air and shoot it?
Maybe...
I'm going to be picking cup shards out of my hair for days now.
You should feel honored. It was an expensive cup.
Uh-huh. Anyway, getting back to what I came here for...
Oh, right. Did you need my help?
Sort of. See... I've been exploring the prospect of getting some non-American heavy industry players to look you over.
See if we can try integrating some different thinking about weapons and armor into your loadout.
I assume this idea was brought to mind as a result of the hole blown open in my side.
You assume correctly. And recently I received a tentative go-ahead from both the U.S. Navy and some overseas business sorts.
Friends of yours?
No. I've never met these people before. I had my friends spread the word. It's a private arms company.
So we're getting some aid? I'm always happy to have some more firepower.
It's not going to be that easy. They want to discuss matters. We're going to meet halfway and negotiate.
More talking... don't these people get we're at war? If we don't do this together, we might as well bend a knee to the Morganas already.
This is what I'm worried about. I don't want you getting worked up around their delegate.
What do you mean by that?
I'm just suggesting that maybe I should handle the talking... on my own.
McDougal?
I'm suppressing every urge to shout right now, since it would just prove you right...
*ALARM*
Well, let's go do something about that mounting rage.
First thing you've said that I can agree with.
@BATTLE
How come we're not moving? I thought we had some meeting to get to.
We have some time left. I figured you might want to get all your frustrations out before the talking starts.
That sounds fantastic. Let's punch something.
Just wait until we find a Morgana. Please.
Then hurry already!
@BATTLE
That was a good idea, Cap.

Fields.MenuText: I have those every once in a while.
What did you just say? Can Belles get concussions?
You think anything involving fighting Morganas is a good idea.

Fields.DialogueText: They're rare, but worth the wait in between ‘em.
Shut up. And... I actually don't know.
True. So it probably wasn't actually that good of an idea.
I think I'm ready put down my guns and talk for a while, Cap.
Well, we're still a ways off, so don't waste your talking time right now.
Yes, Captain. I'll shut up and keep punching.
Better now than later.
I thought you said we were meeting them halfway. It feels like we've gone a lot further than half.
We're almost there. No need to get worked up.
Do I look like I'm worked up? Worked up for me involves a whole lot more yelling and cursing.

Fields.MenuText: You're right, my mistake. If you were worked up, you would be cursing more.
I've found there are varying levels to your anger. At this point, you're at a five or six.
If you're not worked up, you can prove it by being polite and cordial with our guests.

Fields.DialogueText: I might also be shooting and, on all-too-rare occasions, blowing stuff up.
Hmmmm. That's not a bad way of looking at it. I do feel like I'm at a five right now.
Hey, I'll be whatever I damn well want to be. And I haven't decided what that is yet.
Captain, our destination is coming over the horizon.
Great. Hear that, McDougal? We're almost there.
Yippee... ?
We are detecting artillery fire around the area.
Gunshots?! Now I'm excited.
Morganas?
We believe so.
No believing needed; I'm feeling them. There are quite a few just ahead of us.
Sound the alarm. Looks like our diplomatic meeting is starting with a battle.
Just the way I like it!
@BATTLE
Whew... awright, McDougal. Keep your shirt on.
You okay? You look a little antsy.
I'm fine. I just don't remember where to put my hands.

Fields.MenuText: They're your hands. Put ‘em wherever you like.
I generally like to keep them resting at my sides. It's neutral.
Sometimes I'll cross my arms. It has an air of authority to it.

Fields.DialogueText: I know I can. I just feel like there's a specific place I'm supposed to keep them during meetings like this.
That's it! I think... Oh well, good enough.
Hmmmm, well, I like the sound of that.
We fight Morganas every day and a little negotiation gets you flustered?
I'm just a little anxious. First times and all that, you know?
Well, try and relax a little for now. We still have to make port before they even come on board.
Yeah, yeah, I know. I'm just going to head to my room and brush up on some of this stuff.
*ALARM*
Great, more Morganas.
Are our friends close enough to help us out?
They already headed to port. We're on our own.
Good. So I can go all out.
@BATTLE
Hello, welcome aboard our ship. I'm glad we could finally meet.
Yes, well, you certainly took your time making it to us. We ran into a Morgana flock while we waited for you.
And I apologize, but at least we were there to aid you when it mattered.
Mmhmm.
Uh... would you and your party care to join me on the bridge to continue this talk? It has quite the view.
You'll be dealing with me. My men are simply here to inspect the ship. Would that be acceptable?
Of course. Officers, you four, come to me!
Captain?
Please accompany these men around the ship. Show them what they need to see.
Of course. Please follow us.
And you can follow me.
Mmhmm.
Ah, you must be the gentleman we've been waiting for. My name is McDougal, and it's a pleasure to meet you.
A bow, even? It's very nice to meet you, McDougal. You may call me Fujiyama.
Welcome to our home, Mr. Fujiyama. I hope these talks will progress into a fruitful relationship.
I as...
*ALARM*

Fields.MenuText: Now of all times?

Fields.DialogueText: The Morganas have taken to attacking port cities recently. They may have been drawn here by us.
Then it's only right that we put a stop to them before any more damage is done.
@BATTLE

Fields.MenuText: We'll need to get you below.

Fields.DialogueText: I was warned this might happen. We certainly wouldn't be the first to be caught out.

Fields.MenuText: Looks like you'll be seeing our  Belle in action.

Fields.DialogueText: At long last. I've seen enough of the other sort.
McDougal? Why are you hiding down here? Fujiyama is waiting for us upstairs.
Ugh, yuck. Can't you deal with him? I'm a little busy here.
You can shoot holes in your dummy anytime. Besides, he said he didn't want to start without you. I think he's taken a liking to you.
Gross.
Do you have a problem with him? You seemed fine during our first meeting.
It's not just him. They all grind my gears. I was just putting on a face. Acting.
All of them? What do you mean, "them?"
These Japanese bigwigs. Their stiff, formal culture; their weird, imperial politics - and don't even get me started on their food. All that raw fish...

Fields.MenuText: For someone who hates Japan, you seem to know an awful lot about it.
I think they'd have plenty to say about Americans.
You'd eat fish too if you came from an island nation.

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not ignorant. I just don't like what I've learned.
Well, duh! We're the coolest.
I'd have the common sense to grill it first!
Listen, Japan and America are both participating in the Neutrality Fleet, and your prejudice doesn't enter into it.
Okay. Right now, I need you to put your preconceptions aside and help me iron out this deal with our visitor.
And if I hear even a peep from any member of this crew with any personal or family connections to Japan whatsoever that you've so much as looked at them funny...
Hey! My crew isn't Japanese, or French, or even American! They're all citizens of McDouglandia, and that's all that matters!
Don't throw a fit. I'll be right up to charm the pants off Mr. Fuddy-duddy.
Fujiyama.
I know, I'm not an idiot. Just promise me that, after we talk, we can fight a Morgana or something, maybe.
That's probably wise. Burning off some stress would probably do us both good.
Such a sweet talker. I don't know why you need my help.
@BATTLE
Hey, it's not like my feelings are coming out of nowhere! You remember what they did to my cousin Panay back in '37? Anyone would be suspicious.
Despite a few inconvenient engagements with Morganas here and there, my men have managed to look around your ship and find it suitably equipped for the Morgana menace.
Well, don't you know how to make a girl blush.
I'm glad we've met your expectations.
Suitably equipped, huh? My equipment is impressive as fuh-
McDougal, is there anything you wanted to add?
Hm?
Mr. Fujiyama just said that if there weren't any other points to discuss that he was ready to return to his superiors.
Oh, nothing to add from me. It was a pleasure to meet you, Mr. Fujiyama.
The pleasure was all mine, McDougal. Meeting you was truly the highlight of my trip.

Fields.MenuText: I'm certain she feels the same way.
I guess I'm just chopped liver...

Fields.DialogueText: My captain is right, of course. Meeting you was a wonderful addition to my voyage.
Please forgive my captain's sense of humor. It's been some time since any of us have slept.
I must say, you are quite the gentleman, Mr. Fujiyama. I'm sure you have a number of lady friends back home who fawn over you.
Of course. It goes without saying.
Oh, pshaw... I suppose I do have one or two, ha ha ha.
If you ever have the opportunity to drop by and see us again, please do. Don't be a stranger.
That's very unlikely, but I'll keep your offer in mind. Otsukaresama deshita.
Phew, looks like we did it.
Blegh, that left a bad taste in my throat.
Just wash it out with some victory pie. You've earned it.
Mmmm... some good, classic, American apple pie sounds delicious right about now.
Captain, we've spotted some Morganas to the south. They're not heading our way, but...
But nothing. They're mine.
You heard the lady. We have our new destination.
@BATTLE
Itsumo osewa ni natte orimasu.
It's a damned humbling farewell. There's a gazillion layers of etiquette to this stuff. As far as I'm concerned they can keep it.
It's polite. Nothing wrong with a farewell in your guest's language.
Grr...
Ah, hell.
Go on, then. Get it out of your system.
Why are we still here?

Fields.MenuText: Unless we want to jump overboard, we're kind of stuck. And you're screwed no matter what you do.
That's a very esoteric question, and I personally believe there isn't any one answer...
We have to stay in the area until we know if we're getting aid from Japan.

Fields.DialogueText: You know that's not what I mean. Why are we staying so close to Japan?
What? Are you speaking gibberish right now? I mean, why can't we head back home?
Japanese aid, Shmapanese shmaid. Do we really need them?
If we left before hearing from Fujiyama, this whole trip would be a waste. You'd have kissed up to him for nothing.
Ugh, fine. Just don't remind me. Makes me feel sick.
Look, you're part of a multinational effort. In a lot of ways, you're a living symbol of a multinational effort. So buck up.
You'll feel better when we return with new allies in this fight.
Can we just find something to kill before I vomit?
If I can point you in the direction of a Morgana, I don't see why not.
Get your guns ready, Cap. It shouldn't take too long.
@BATTLE
Listen, not that you asked me....
I'm asking you.
Oh. Good call!
If we continue coming to the same port we're going to start looking desperate.

Fields.MenuText: What do you mean "start?" We are desperate.
If you have any other ideas, I'm open to suggestions.
This is you just trying to get some more combat in, isn't it?

Fields.DialogueText: You might be. I couldn't care less.
How about we go and fight until we can't stand anymore. They'll have gotten back to us by then, for sure.
Heh, you caught me. Guilty.
Either way, I guess we can't sit in the harbor all day. We might as well go and kill some time.
What a wonderful idea. I'll grab my gun.
I say kill and she jumps.
Captain, we just received a transmission.
A transmission? Not a letter this time. What did they say?
... It's not good news.
Seriously? Well, now McDougal's not the only one that wants to punch a Morgana in the face.
Captain?
Never mind. Let's just get moving. No need to stay here anymore.
Yes, Captain.
And if we see any Morganas, you know what to do.
Yes, I'll pull a McDougal.
Is that what we're calling it now? Can't say it isn't appropriate.
@BATTLE
@BATTLE
Oh, yeah, that felt good. One more victory for the great McDougal.
Hey, wait a minute... aren't we getting a little too far east? We're getting away from Japan-Land.

Fields.MenuText: That's the point.
Japan-Land? Seriously?
I thought that's what you wanted.

Fields.DialogueText: I thought we were waiting to hear word from Fujiyaddayadda.
Well, I thought it was better than the Raw Fish Isles.
Well, yeah, it's what I wanted, but I thought you wanted the opposite.
Seriously, what's up?
We got word back. It just wasn't the word we wanted to hear.
Ooooh! Damn, seriously? So we just did all that for nothing?
Not nothing. We learned that even with Morganas, nations will still find a way to quarrel amongst themselves.
I can't believe I sunk so low as to be nice to that gerbil-faced bastard. I should've punched him square in the jaw when I had the chance!
It's not his... look, just tone it down. I'm too disappointed to argue.
Let's just get half a world away from those idiots. We can deal with the Morganas on our own.
Oh, and if we run into any more Morganas, we take our stress out on them.
What a one-track mind you have, McDougal.
It's the best track to be on when there's something in your way.
@BATTLE
Morganas again? You'd think an island nation would be all over a seaborne threat.
Maybe the Morganas had that very thing in mind. Go for the easy targets first.
Oh, they're easy targets, all right.
That's enough out of you. The next words out of your mouth better be explosions.
Works for me!
Just say "the delegate" if you must. I know you know better.
The Imperial Navy recognizes the common enemy in the Morganas, but they're stopping short of sharing technology. Fujiyama hinted that an admiral leaned on them pretty hard to that effect.
No-good Japanese supplies. You think you're fully stocked, but just a few encounters later, you need a resupply.
Stop it, McDougal.
We might have enough supplies for a couple of weeks if we stretch it out. Or we could head straight to port. What do you think?
What do you think I think, Cap?

Fields.MenuText: Yeah, let's go straight to port.
Heh, yeah, let's find some Morganas. Use what we've got left.
Do I look like a mind reader?

Fields.DialogueText: Now, we both know that's not what we're going to do.
That's why you're the captain. You know how to keep me happy.
I'm still not sure. How many fingers am I holding up?
Eight. And a half.
Seriously? I'm holding up one hand.
McDougal, Captain, we've heard word of Morganas attacking a port city nearby. What are our orders?
Sound the alarm and ready the artillery. Time to let them know we're back in town.
@BATTLE
In any event, we resupplied where we did for a reason. You'll find a way to make it work.
Of course I will. I'm me.
That wasn't an endorsement. If I find out you've been wasting supplies out of some childish grudge...
Yeah, I get the picture, Captain.
Be sure to get more pie. I just ate the last one.
Any specific flavor?
Surprise me... oh, but make sure at least half are apple.
Half?
Did I stutter?
Okay, half it is.

Fields.MenuText: Scaring the crew again, I see.
With all the pie you eat, you should be bigger than the ship.
Get me a few blueberry ones too!

Fields.DialogueText: I'm not scaring anyone. He asked if there was anything I wanted.
If I were, you could all sail on me and I could fight the Morganas in hand to hand combat. Wouldn't that be fantastic?
Yeah, you heard the captain. Our mighty leader needs blueberries.
Hey, Captain... we're going to be okay without the extra Japanese aid, right?

Fields.MenuText: That's a surprising question, coming from you.
We could still get aid from someone else.
We've got plenty of aid. Every member of our crew is aiding us in this war.

Fields.DialogueText: I've just been thinking about... well, everything. I might be a little worried.
I guess you're right. But what if they say no too? What if we're on our own?
You know what I mean. There's only so much one crew can do.
For now, we'll be fine. We haven't met many Morganas who've truly challenged you.
Battles can be won with brute force. But this is war. War requires strategies.
Are you saying it's over your head?
No, don't be an idiot. Nothing is over my head. I'm just saying... I'm going to have to start thinking more.
Don't hurt yourself.
Shut up before I hurt you.
Hahaha!
... You still trust me, right?
Yeah. You still trust me?
Of course. That's why we're going to start strategizing together. Rather than just barrelling into every Morgana we see. Sound like a plan?
It sounds good to me, Cap. Let's try it out.
@BATTLE
McDougal, I need to talk to you about something.
What's up?
We talked about strategizing, remember?
Yeah... Oh! Is this a strategy meeting? Where's the war table and maps and colored pins and stuff?
... No, this isn't anything like that. I wanted to talk with you about something important before I made a decision.
Oh, well, spit it out.
We received a transmission from Japan. Apparently, the Morganas are mounting a major push on the Port of Tokyo. They're requesting our help. Your help, specifically.
They want our help? After dismissing us when we asked them the same thing?

Fields.MenuText: It's a good thing poetic justice is understood across all cultures.
Still, they're in trouble. How much would you hate helping?
You know, they might only be asking us because you were so nice and charming with their delegate before.

Fields.DialogueText: If they want our help, then I expect them to get on their knees and beg before I so much as lift a finger.
Oh, a lot.
Dammit. Why did I have to be so charming? I really don't want to go back to that pile of rocks.
Then again... this would be a heck of a fight, right? I mean, to move on Tokyo, you'd need to be pretty impressive.
Apparently, they've barely been able to slow the attackers down.
Oh, that's so tempting! We have to go. I can't turn down that sort of challenge.
All right. Let's go.
@BATTLE
You remember the plan, right?
Hell, yeah. I helped come up with it.

Fields.MenuText: We lure them away from the port and then tear them limb from limb.
We take care of the peons hanging around it before blowing the main one to smithereens.
We throw everything we have at it. If we succeed, we can restock on the spot.

Fields.DialogueText: Exactly. That way, the city won't get caught in the attack.
Oh, yeah. And if we run out of explosives, I've got Mr. Contingency-Plan as our back-up.
That's what I like to call the apocalypse plan. Nothing can handle it.
And hey, if the Japanese don't want me playing with their toys, I'll get them from elsewhere. When we defeat the Morganas, I want one of their guns as a souvenir.
Any gun in particular?
That big one, right up front. ... That is a gun, isn't it?
I'm not exactly sure what that is. These Morganas can be difficult to figure out.
Whatever, I want it! Let's just go!
@BATTLE
Feel that, Captain?
I know what you're talking about. Morganas.
It's making my armor crawl.
I shouldn't even have to say this, but keep collateral damage to a minimum.
Look, Captain...
Yes, McDougal?
Fuji... Fujiyama really wanted to help, didn't he?
He wants to make the seas safe as much as you do. I got the impression he was quite frustrated by the IJN intervention.
Bureaucrats. They bog everything down.
I think that frustration is universal.
Heh. Maybe we're not so different. In that way, at least.
Listen, don't think this changes how I feel.
Could anything?
Can it. You said before I'd sink myself trying to win this war on my own. I'm gonna prove you wrong first chance I get to make the choice.
No matter who offers it?
We all float the same. Anyone who aims to keep it that way... I can work with that.
We'll need to.
Okay, Captain. Don't just stand there grinning like an idiot.
Say whatever it is you're holding in.
I can't believe you're hanging that thing up.
Of course I am. Not only is it a badass Morgana thing, it's a trophy.

Fields.MenuText: Then hang it up in your own room.
I guess it looks pretty good above my desk.
It's a little scary.

Fields.DialogueText: No way! We both earned this. I've gotta share the glory.
If this doesn't project an air of authority, I don't know what will.
That's the point. Everyone should fear their captain a little bit.
Hey, uh, any word from those munitions guys in Japan?
Yeah, they sent their thanks, as well as an offer to continue conversations about a collaborative pilot program.
"Continue conversations?" Really? Not just... I dunno, throwing stuff at us in gratitude?
Actually, there are problems on the American side, too. They don't want to risk looking as if they're legitimizing Japanese actions on the mainland, for one thing.
If it turned out that any of the parts or raw materials came from China...
Really? Really, they're only thinking of this now?
Apparently the behind-the-scenes negotiations have been kind of fraught from the start.
UGH.
Yeah. I suggest we go find something to shoot to take our minds off it all.
... You keep talking like that, and I'll follow you to the ends of the earth.
Is that a threat or a promise?
You got a problem with me? I can still take down this pointy thing and stick it into you. You wanna get skewered?
Calm down, I was joking!
I'll calm down when I'm good and ready! And I'm not yet. So get out of my face before I pull out my pistol.
These are my quarters!
You say something?
... There should be some confiscated Scotch in the footlocker.
It's at least something.
Which one?
*ALARM*
Tell you after the fight. The bigger the explosion, the bigger your share.
Now we're talking!
